$interpreted:
Pang: ...So, this is the Desert Bazaar?
Indeed, quite an impressive sight.

Shop Owner: Ah, good day, Sir! Come, see for yourself!
We specialize in protective gear and gloves. What you see is what you get, fair and square!
Pang: Emm... not of the finest quality I'd say...
Pang: Those croissants hanging over there seem quite tasty, a meal box of sorts?
Shop Owner: Ah, apologies, Sir. That's a custom delivery item, so it's not for sale.
Pang: Is that so? What a shame.

Stewart: Shopkeeper, 
The "exquisite delicious creature" I requested, have you finally gotten your hands on it?
Shop Owner: Yes, indeed. Here it is.
Shop Owner: Took quite a few skilled hunters to finally capture this thing alive.

Bodyguard: So this is the exquisite delicious creature?
Dang, it sure does look tasty...

Stewart: I'll be selling this to the lizard nobles.
You better not try anything funny..
Stewart: ... Although, I do wish to have a taste for myself too...
Bodyguard: But those rich folks in the desert really don't give a damn about money. The amount they are willing to pay for a bite of this creature is jaw-dropping.
Stewart: This thing has strikingly similar traits to a creature so tasty that it was literally eaten to extinction one hundred years ago.
Stewart: Of course they would empty their banks just for a taste. You don't get second chances on this, ya know!

Bodyguard: Magnificent. Boss,
if we are able to secure the lizard nobles' goodwill,
Bodyguard: we can get ourselves out of the massive hole we're in now.
Stewart: Hmph, I got screwed in the previous Whistlewood Valley case. Also, thanks to old bastard Charle, I've been sanctioned by the Commerce Chamber since.
Stewart: But indeed, you only live twice. Time for my rise after fall, HAHA~!

Puggi: Tsk tsk, my bodyguard has finally arrived.
You're gonna be dead meat soon, fatso!
Pang: WHAT!?
Stewart: You're here to rescue him?
Pang: No, I do not recall ever crossing paths with this bird...
Puggi: Catch me if you can~ Now you see me, now you don't~ Haha, look at you, fatso; out of breath already? You need exercise~
Stewart: Shoot! Get this big fella out of the way and bring me back that damn bird!

Pang: Hold it, I am of no acquaintance with him...
Is anybody even listening to me?

Stewart: Damnit! Don't count on your luck just yet,
I'm definitely coming back to get that damn bird!
Pang: But I really don't have any past history with him...
Stewart: Men, retreat.
Pang: Hey, hear me out!

Puggi: Nice job buddy, you have earned the title of "trustworthy sidekick". You shall escort yours truly, the star of the show, on this trip.
Let's embark on journeys to the end of the world and carry out deeds to succeed our names!

Pang: Owner, apologies for disrupting your business.
Here's your produce.
Shop Owner: Nice try, jerk. It's your mess now, don't you dare get me involved with your bull****!
Pang: What do you mean?
Shop Owner: The folks you just pummeled have direct contact with the lizard nobles. Should they relay the blame on me, I can kiss the Desert Bazaar goodbye!
Pang: The lizard nobles, are they really that cruel and heartless?

Shop Owner: It's the rule of thumb for every merchant here: as long as you earn their favor, great fortunes shall await you. 
However, should you tread on their tails, they will do whatever it takes to bring you down to the depths of hell.
Shop Owner: Crap, I have a feeling that something's about to go terribly wrong. I'm off, you can have the little fella.
Pang: Hey, wait up!
Puggi: Let's go, time to move on to the next destination!
Pang: Although it's a misunderstanding, please behave yourself from now on. We shall go our separate ways. Goodbye.
Puggi: Awww, c'mon, don't be intimidated by my protagonist aura~
Pang: ......Get lost, leave me alone.

Puggi: We can work together as a team.
You can take the gold character position...
Pang: I said, GET LOST!

Model.Text:
...So, this is the Desert Bazaar?
Indeed, quite an impressive sight.

Ah, good day, Sir! Come, see for yourself!
We specialize in protective gear and gloves. What you see is what you get, fair and square!
Emm... not of the finest quality I'd say...
Those croissants hanging over there seem quite tasty, a meal box of sorts?
Ah, apologies, Sir. That's a custom delivery item, so it's not for sale.
Is that so? What a shame.

Shopkeeper, 
The "exquisite delicious creature" I requested, have you finally gotten your hands on it?
Yes, indeed. Here it is.
Took quite a few skilled hunters to finally capture this thing alive.

So this is the exquisite delicious creature?
Dang, it sure does look tasty...

I'll be selling this to the lizard nobles.
You better not try anything funny..
... Although, I do wish to have a taste for myself too...
But those rich folks in the desert really don't give a damn about money. The amount they are willing to pay for a bite of this creature is jaw-dropping.
This thing has strikingly similar traits to a creature so tasty that it was literally eaten to extinction one hundred years ago.
Of course they would empty their banks just for a taste. You don't get second chances on this, ya know!

Magnificent. Boss,
if we are able to secure the lizard nobles' goodwill,
we can get ourselves out of the massive hole we're in now.
Hmph, I got screwed in the previous Whistlewood Valley case. Also, thanks to old bastard Charle, I've been sanctioned by the Commerce Chamber since.
But indeed, you only live twice. Time for my rise after fall, HAHA~!

Tsk tsk, my bodyguard has finally arrived.
You're gonna be dead meat soon, fatso!
WHAT!?
You're here to rescue him?
No, I do not recall ever crossing paths with this bird...
Catch me if you can~ Now you see me, now you don't~ Haha, look at you, fatso; out of breath already? You need exercise~
Shoot! Get this big fella out of the way and bring me back that damn bird!

Hold it, I am of no acquaintance with him...
Is anybody even listening to me?

Damnit! Don't count on your luck just yet,
I'm definitely coming back to get that damn bird!
But I really don't have any past history with him...
Men, retreat.
Hey, hear me out!

Nice job buddy, you have earned the title of "trustworthy sidekick". You shall escort yours truly, the star of the show, on this trip.
Let's embark on journeys to the end of the world and carry out deeds to succeed our names!

Owner, apologies for disrupting your business.
Here's your produce.
Nice try, jerk. It's your mess now, don't you dare get me involved with your bull****!
What do you mean?
The folks you just pummeled have direct contact with the lizard nobles. Should they relay the blame on me, I can kiss the Desert Bazaar goodbye!
The lizard nobles, are they really that cruel and heartless?

It's the rule of thumb for every merchant here: as long as you earn their favor, great fortunes shall await you. 
However, should you tread on their tails, they will do whatever it takes to bring you down to the depths of hell.
Crap, I have a feeling that something's about to go terribly wrong. I'm off, you can have the little fella.
Hey, wait up!
Let's go, time to move on to the next destination!
Although it's a misunderstanding, please behave yourself from now on. We shall go our separate ways. Goodbye.
Awww, c'mon, don't be intimidated by my protagonist aura~
......Get lost, leave me alone.

We can work together as a team.
You can take the gold character position...
I said, GET LOST!
